abstract.p: David Grinnell letter on Herbert Muschamp's August 27 article on move toward filling empty public spaces opposes plan for World War II memorial on Washington Mall (S)

block.p: Herbert Muschamp's article ''Public Space or Private, a Compulsion to Fill It'' [Aug. 27] on the contemporary American inability to leave open space alone is timely. There is no better example of this current ruinous compulsion than the misguided plans for a World War II memorial in our nation's capital on the Mall. The proposed site is between the Lincoln Memorial and the Washington Monument. The plan would consume the existing rainbow pool for the site of the new memorial and thus destroy the grandest vista of our nation's capital. An appreciation for this sweeping open space would not dare disturb its beauty and tranquillity. Indeed, this is why the land is already a dedicated part of the Lincoln Memorial.
